H0.text: Integumentary and endocrine systems are the two primary body systems that work together to produce the response when a cook touches a hot stove and quickly moves his hand away.

H1.text: Muscular and respiratory systems work together to produce the quick withdrawal of the hand when a cook touches a hot stove.

H2.text: The nervous and muscular systems are the two primary body systems that work together to produce the quick response of a cook moving his hand away after touching a hot stove.

H3.text: The skeletal and nervous systems are the two primary body systems that work together to produce the response when a cook touches a hot stove and quickly moves his hand away.

A4.text: The excitatory signals induce contraction of the muscle cells, which causes the joint angles in the arm to change, pulling the arm away.
